name: NPR
text:
President-elect Joe Biden on Monday outlined his plan for rehabilitating the U.S. economy, emphasizing the importance of getting control of the pandemic.  

"More people may die if we don't coordinate," Biden said. https://t.co/km5289axUa

name: NPR
text:
Hate crimes rose to their highest numbers in a decade, with a record-breaking 51 fatal attacks, according to an FBI report of 2019 data. Experts emphasize the tally is an undercount.
https://t.co/bl87DAhFWa

name: NPR
text:
NPR wants to hear: What are your favorite holiday traditions? Are you modifying or skipping any this year in the pandemic ‚Äî or maybe making up new ones?

Fill out the form linked here, and an NPR producer may contact you to follow up.
https://t.co/ykouElPxm8

name: NPR
text:
Central America is bracing for the potentially catastrophic impact of Hurricane Iota, a Category 5 storm, as it barreled down the northern coast of Nicaragua on Monday evening.
https://t.co/nwoaLOI1e8

name: NPR
text:
The coronavirus pandemic has eliminated ‚Äî or cut short ‚Äî many opportunities for youth athletes to participate or compete in sports.

A recent study says that could have a lasting impact.
https://t.co/4tDJYWEY9w

name: NPR
text:
Your children may have questions about the coronavirus, what it is and what to do to stay safe. Here's what experts say ‚Äî boiled down for kids.
https://t.co/xJfMzChGQM

name: NPR
text:
We're tracking how the virus has affected individual members of Congress. Here's the latest.
https://t.co/GgGF05u7KM

text:
